titles.title: Long-Term Care for Families Act of 2000
To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to allow a refundable credit for long-term care and to offset the revenue cost of the credit by revising the rules on expatriation.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

bill.summary: 4/3/2000--Introduced. Long-Term Care for Families Act of 2000 - Amends the Internal Revenue Code to allow a limited family care credit to an eligible caregiver for the care of an eligible individual with long- term care needs.Revises tax rules concerning expatriates to, subject to exception, consider all property of a covered expatriate as sold, for its fair market value, on the day before the expatriation date.
